Articles.Content: installed it, tested it quickly...worked fine, no problem for now.

I've been using it for a couple of days, no issues beyond those present in .22; in rare cases (haven't been able to nail it down, might be a mod-part etc) the rebuilt vessel becomes grabbed but unplaceable since there isn't a root in the build space. Adding a second leads to very bad things.

Just install or download 7-zip and extract it. It is open source. Nothing to worry about. Far better than any closed source stuff like WinRAR or WinZip that keeps spamming you with ads.

Does nobody realize that Winrar can be used without having to worry about popups, and that it will handle .7z files no problem? You don't have to buy it.

Just right-click the file, Extract Here or Extract To... and it just works without opening the main Winrar GUI, and without popping any nags.

That said, 7Zip is also capable of exporting regular zip files, if the user takes more than a hot second to actually look at the interface and select it.

Would it be possible to get this functionality in-flight? I have encountered a situation where that would be immensely helpful/mission critical (Deadly Reentry in combination with probes built as upside-down subassemblies - problem is that a parts that burns up is the root part, and KSP stops tracking the remaining parts if the root part explodes. Solution would be to rebuild the probe in-flight after separation from the mothership)
Still working in .23, thanks for making this mod! Helped me to attach rovers and landers to my Laythe ship.

Hello,

I am getting a weird problem with this installed. After I used it the ship name disappeared in the VAB and won't reappear. Even after removing the mod
I had this, it was causd by the part welder mod.
Thanks so much for this mod! saved me a ton of rework
Does anyone have a .zip version?
This awesome plugin still works in .23!

This awesome plugin still works in .23!

Right, it works perfectly fine. And if it ever won't, I'm pretty sure it will be picked up by someone should the original author no longer maintain it. It's just too useful
about struts and lines, same issue here, cant deattach and reattach- not an option, lifter has way too many components to do this. bummer
Just discovered this today, after smashing my head against the problem of attaching rovers to things for days... So great! How the heck do people stick rovers on stuff without this?
I tried playing KSP without this, and today I snapped. Hooray for SelectRoot!

I just want to say that control+shift+left click is my favourite combo in KSP

o7
I use this all the time. Love it.
Yeah, this has become a standard mod for me. I really appreciate it.
Whenever I try to do something in stock, this is the first mod I miss. I usually ctrl-shift-click several times trying to figure out what's wrong before I remember that this isn't stock KSP.

Whenever I try to do something in stock, this is the first mod I miss. I usually ctrl-shift-click several times trying to figure out what's wrong before I remember that this isn't stock KSP.

Why wouldn't you add this to stock? It's not a part. It saves some build time in VAB/SPH which is a must given how limited VAB is.

Why wouldn't you add this to stock? It's not a part. It saves some build time in VAB/SPH which is a must given how limited VAB is.

If a challenge says "Stock only" and I use this, I have violated the rules of the challenge in my mind. Even if I then copy the craft to a "pure" stock game it was created in a non-stock way. Like it or not, this mod allows you to create ships that you could not create in stock.

Oddly enough, I have no problem building a ship with Kerbal Engineer installed and then copying IT to a stock install to participate in a challenge. The ship built with KER could have been built in the stock game so it's fine.
Thanks a lot! The most useful plugin I ever tried!
This is incredibly badass. Does this work with 0.23?

This is incredibly badass. Does this work with 0.23?

Yes, it does.

For Windows, dowload 7ZIP first from >>HERE<<.

If your browser opens 7zip it as plain text, then right click on OP's link, then SAVE TARGET AS...

After installed 7zip, Rightclick on 7z file and EXTRACT TO...
